article:
'Dispatchers' are communications personnel responsible for receiving and
transmitting pure and reliable messages, tracking vehicles and equipment, and
recording other important information. A number of organizations,
including police and fire departments, emergency medical services, taxicab
providers, trucking companies, train stations, and public utility companies, use
dispatchers to relay information and coordinate their operations. Essentially,
the dispatcher is the "conductor" of the force, and is responsible for the
direction of all units within it.
